incidents.name: Elevated error rate across all Network tiers

incident_updates.body: We identified an issue that caused an elevated error rate across all Content Delivery Network (CDN) tiers. The incident began at 11:16 UTC and was fully resolved by 11:19 UTC.

incidents.name: Build logs unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue with the logs not appearing as well as the pending lag for old logs to get the build logs in the UI now seems to be resolved, but we're continuing to monitor the issue further.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We're investigating issues where build logs are not loading for various users.

incidents.name: Elevated error rate across all Network tiers

incident_updates.body: We identified an elevated error rate across all CDN tiers, from 18:09 -> 18:15 UTC. This issue has since been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased errors in image processing for Next.js runtime v4

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The team has identified the issue with distorted images as being with Function invocations on the Starter tier and not with Next.js as initially thought. A fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating reports of distorted images using the old Next.js runtime v4.

incidents.name: Increased error with Edge Functions across the CDN

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The team has identified the root cause and fixed it. We're continuing to monitor the issue. If you see issues with Edge Functions, please contact our Support team.
We see an increased number of Edge Functions errors, affecting both the Standard and High Performance Edge CDN. Our team is investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increase in failing deploys

incident_updates.body: The incident should now be resolved. Affected users should be able to retry builds from the UI.
The build errors have stopped and we are now monitoring the situation.
We're investigating issues with deploys failing across all tiers.

incident_updates.body: The incident is resolved.
We have resolved the cause of the errors and we are monitoring now to confirm.
Our team has identified the root cause and is implementing the fix.
We are currently investigating an increase in Edge Function errors across all network tiers.

incidents.name: Missing Edge Function logs for historical invocations

incident_updates.body: Historical logs working as normal and no data loss occurred.
Backfilling has been completed and we are ingesting real-time logs now.
The process of backfilling logs is still ongoing, they have been backfilled until April 15, 09:00 UTC
The logs continue to be backfilled.
We've deployed a fix and are currently backfilling the data. There was no data loss but the process to restore the data will take a few hours.
Our team has identified the root cause of the problem and is working on a solution.
We are investigating reports of missing Edge Functions historical logs.

incidents.name: Increased latency across the CDN

incident_updates.body: From 5:04 AM UTC to 5:52 AM UTC, we saw an increase in latency for uncached content on both, the Standard Edge and the High Performance Edge Network. This issue should now be resolved.

incidents.name: Increased edge function errors for Standard Edge Network

incident_updates.body: We have resolved an issue that caused increased edge function errors for the Standard Edge Network between 22:47 to 23:45 UTC.
The issue appears to be resolved and we are monitoring to confirm the resolution.
There is an issue causing increased errors for edge functions on the Standard Edge Network. We believe we have identified the cause and are working to resolve the issue now.

components.name: Edge Functions

incidents.name: Some Image CDN requests failed

incident_updates.body: Between 17:25 UTC on April 9 and 10:15 UTC on April 10th, uncached Image CDN request failed due to a defect in the code. We have identified the root cause and are working to prevent it from happening again.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates on HP Edge Network

incident_updates.body: Between 15:20:30 - 15:22:20 UTC on April 8 we experienced elevated error rates on our HP Edge network. We have identified the root cause and are working to prevent it from happening again.

incidents.name: Issue preventing adding new sites via the web app

incident_updates.body: We resolved an issue that prevented adding new sites via the web app between 15:42 and 18:17 UTC on 2024-03-22. The issue has been resolved and sites can be added again now.

incidents.name: Intermittent errors on Netlify Core

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified what is impacting performance and have put remediations in place.
After further troubleshooting, we are still investigating and will update as we have more information.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are seeing intermittent errors for some customers and we’re currently investigating.

incidents.name: Increased errors for the Connect service

incident_updates.body: We have resolved an issue that caused an increase in errors for the Connect service between 22:27 and 23:10 UTC on 2024-03-07.

incidents.name: Increase in Failed Edge Function Invocations

incident_updates.body: The issue is now fully resolved.
The team found the root cause of this issue and applied the necessary mitigations. We're monitoring the system now.
The team is still working on closing in on the root cause of this issue.
Our team is still investigating this issue.
Since 7:45 UTC, we've been experiencing an increase in failed Edge Function Invocations. The team is investigating.

incidents.name: Problem serving some Next.js sites using Next.js runtime older then 4.41.3

incident_updates.body: We have identified the root cause and have a fix ready. Unfortunately, the fix cannot be rolled out to our network but would require an impacted site to be redeployed individually. Upgrading to Next.js Runtime v4.41.3 will resolve the issues. If you cannot upgrade your Next.js Runtime to v4.41.3, please reach out to our support team.
Our team is still investigating the root cause of the incident.
We are continuing to investigate the issue to determinethe the root cause.
Problem serving Next.js sites using Next.js runtime older than 4.41.3. This can be fixed updating to 4.41.3 of the Netlify Next.js runtime.

components.name: Netlify Functions
components.description: Serverless functions open a world of possibilities for running on-demand, server-side code without having to run a dedicated server.

incidents.name: Delays in some High Performance Builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

As of 15:00 UTC, a fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. In addition to delays, we observed elevated errors affecting some High Performance Builds. If you have experienced failed builds during this period, please try to redeploy your builds. Should you continue to encounter any issues, please contact our Support team.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Since 14:00 UTC, we’ve seen delays in some High Performance Builds. Currently, the team is investigating.

Since 00:00 UTC, we’ve been experiencing delays in some High Performance Builds. The team is investigating.

incidents.name: High error rates on our legacy load balancer

incident_updates.body: At 11:52 UTC This incident has been resolved.

Starting at 11:21 UTC we are seeing an increase in error rates and latencies on our legacy load balancer. The team is currently investigating. Users using 104.198.14.52 as the load balancer for their apex domains were affected. Please refer to our current load balancer details in our docs: https://docs.netlify.com/domains-https/custom-domains/configure-external-dns/#configure-an-apex-domain

incidents.name: Increase in Failed Edge Function Invocations on HP Edge

incident_updates.body: Between 14:15 to 14:27 UTC, we saw an increase in errors invoking Edge Functions in the Central Europe regions, impacting HP Edge customers. The issue has been resolved and our team is monitoring Edge Functions.

incident_updates.body: Due to a faulty deploy, some sites on our standard edge network experienced 404 errors between 12:36 - 14:45 UTC. This issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased errors in login page for Netlify App

incident_updates.body: Between 04:39 UTC and 09:27 UTC we experienced an increase in errors on our App, specifically affecting the login flow.

incidents.name: Increase in Failed Edge Function Invocations on HP Edge

incident_updates.body: From 09:01 UTC to 09:38 UTC, we saw an increase in errors invoking Edge Functions in the Amsterdam and Stockholm regions, impacting HP Edge customers. The issue has been resolved and our team is monitoring Edge Functions.

incidents.name: Failure to receive Edge Functions logs on the Standard Edge Network

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue that caused Edge Functions logs to not reach our systems on the Standard Edge Network from November 29th, 13:00 UTC until Nov 30th, 11:00 UTC. The invocations of Edge Functions were not impacted, and the logs on the HP Edge Network continued to be delivered. Our team has rolled out a fix and the issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Errors on Standard Edge Network

incident_updates.body: Our team is addressing some errors that are impacting the Standard Edge Network in the US-East region. The team has identified and resolved the issue.

A fix for this as been deployed for this and we are monitoring to confirm the resolution.

We are currently investigating reports of SSO/SAML login issues affecting Enterprise accounts using this feature. The Git host SSO logins for non-Enterprise accounts are not impacted by this incident.

incidents.name: Increased errors in image processing for Next.js and Gatsby

incident_updates.body: Increased errors in framework-based image processing across all networks from 17:56 UTC on November 14 until 00:00 UTC on November 15. The issue has been resolved. If you have a Next.js or Gatsby site that was built during the impacted period, a rebuild should restore the image processing functionality.

incidents.name: Increased errors on Standard Edge network

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Our service-wide fix is live.  Our team will continue to monitor.

We've begun implementing a fix for all sites seeing the problem.  In the meantime, if your site is seeing recent 500 errors only in the past few hours, you may contact our tech support team (https://www.netlify.com/support) for a stopgap fix.  We'll post again when the service-wide fix is live.
The issue has been identified to the recent deprecation of post processing. Sites that had that already disabled should be unaffected.
We're investigating some HTTP 500 errors on HTML assets for some users.

components.name: Standard Edge Network
components.description: The Standard Edge Network serves web pages for Starter, Pro, and Business accounts

incidents.name: Stuck cancelled builds

incident_updates.body: We have cancelled all remaining stuck builds and do not expect recurrence.

We've fixed the root cause and are working to preemptively cancel any stuck builds.  Customers may self-serve on cancelling these builds via our UI using the "Cancel deploy" button and new builds will go through as intended.

Some customers who use our ignore builds feature may have had builds get stuck since 9:11 UTC.  Our team has applied a fix so new builds should not get stuck and are working to remediate existing stuck builds.  If you have a stuck build, hit the "Cancel deploy" button in our UI to unblock yourself, otherwise any stuck builds will time out soon.

incidents.name: Increase in Functions failures

incident_updates.body: All customers have been notified of the fix to the functions service degradation.  Our team will continue to monitor but we do not expect recurrence of this situation.

We have determined the impact of this incident was to a very small subset of customers, to whom we are reaching out to facilitate a fix to the affected functions.  We do not expect new occurrences before our longer term fix is implemented.  However, in case you see sudden lambda HTTP 500 errors please reach out to our Support team for advice.
We have seen an increase in failures for Functions invocations starting at 11:30 UTC. Our team is investigating.

incidents.name: Network timeouts on HP Network, in the Canada Region

incident_updates.body: Between 5:52 UTC and 6:08 UTC, we experienced network timeouts on our High Performance Network in the Canada Region. The issue is now resolved.

incidents.name: Some edge functions logs missing

incident_updates.body: We have resolved an issue where some Edge Function logs were not retained between 2023-09-14 20:29 UTC and 2023-09-14 22:25 UTC. This impacted Edge Function logs for all plan levels. Some of the Edge Function logs may be missing for sites during this time window and those logs cannot be recovered. Logs before and after these times will be complete.

incidents.name: Errors with serving some SSL certificates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. Affected sites have been repaired and should be loading SSL certificates without issues now.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We've identified that some sites are failing to load due to a problem accessing their certificate. We're working to repair, but in case this is affecting your site(s) please update your DNS settings per our documentation here: https://docs.netlify.com/domains-https/custom-domains/configure-external-dns/#configure-an-apex-domain
